intro: Randia lanepoolei, commonly known as the Lanepoole's randia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in warm climates for its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
